benchmark_details.name: Synthetic Context Retrieval Dataset for Named Entity Recognition
benchmark_details.overview: This paper presents a synthetic context retrieval dataset generated using Alpaca for enhancing named entity recognition (NER) performance in long documents.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To train a neural context retriever for NER using a synthetic dataset that improves context retrieval performance.

data.source: Synthetic data generated using Alpaca from input sentences in an English literary dataset composed of the first chapter of 40 books.
data.size: 2,716 examples for Alpaca-7B and 2,722 examples for Alpaca-13B

methodology.calculation: F1 score computed on the performance of various retrieval configurations.
methodology.interpretation: Higher F1 scores indicate better performance in NER tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: F1 score of 98.01 for the neural retriever on the evaluation portion of the dataset.
methodology.validation: Trained on the synthetic retrieval dataset over 3 epochs.

targeted_risks.harm: Potential biases in language model generated outputs.
